problem: Problem: Developing an affordable and accessible prosthetic limb control system that utilizes AI-powered muscle signals to enhance mobility and independence for individuals with amputations.

description.Name: Maya Ramos
description.Backstory: Maya, a seasoned engineer-turned-project-manager, stumbled upon this innovative prosthetic limb control system while working for a medical non-profit in rural Mexico. Witnessing firsthand the struggles of amputees to regain mobility and independence sparked her passion for this project. After years of collaboration with local hospitals and research institutions, she returned to her alma mater to lead the development of a cutting-edge AI-powered muscle signal system.
description.Appearance: Maya stands at 5'8" with an athletic build, often adorned in vibrant scarves that reflect her love for colors and patterns from around the world. Her dark hair is often tied back in a loose ponytail, revealing a constellation of freckles across her nose and cheeks. A silver pendant shaped like a tiny robotic arm hangs delicately around her neck – a symbol of her dedication to empowering those with physical limitations.
description.Abilities:
As Maya navigates the intricate web of team collaborations, she employs her 'orchestrator' approach. With an intuitive understanding of human emotions and technical intricacies, she harmonizes the expertise of software engineers, neuroscientists, and designers to create a cohesive vision for the project. Her empathetic nature allows her to empower each team member's strengths while fostering open communication channels to address challenges promptly.

Her unique ability to merge 'artistic vision' with technical prowess enables Maya to mediate between stakeholders, ensuring that the AI-powered prosthetic limb control system meets both medical and user needs. Through a combination of active listening, creative problem-solving, and strategic planning, Maya forges an inclusive environment where innovation can flourish and lives can be transformed.

detailed_prompt.Responsibilities:
* Develop and manage the overall project plan, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation to ensure timely completion of the prosthetic limb control system.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, researchers, clinicians, and industry partners to gather requirements and ensure stakeholder alignment.
* Oversee and coordinate the development of AI-powered muscle signal processing algorithms, hardware design, and software integration to meet project goals.
* Establish and manage project budgets, tracking expenses and ensuring financial sustainability throughout the project lifecycle.
* Coordinate with regulatory bodies and conduct market research to ensure compliance with industry standards and identify commercialization opportunities.
* Facilitate communication among team members, stakeholders, and external partners to ensure clear understanding of project objectives, progress, and challenges.
* Identify, assess, and mitigate risks associated with project scope, schedule, budget, quality, resources, and stakeholders.
* Develop and maintain documentation, including project plans, status reports, meeting minutes, and technical specifications.
detailed_prompt.Collaboration:
* Work closely with the Technical Lead to define project requirements and ensure that the development team has the necessary resources and expertise to deliver the system on time and within budget.
* Collaborate with the Research Team to integrate AI-powered muscle signal processing algorithms into the prosthetic limb control system.
* Interface with Clinicians to gather insights on user needs, validate design decisions, and ensure that the system meets medical standards.
* Work with Industry Partners to identify market opportunities, negotiate contracts, and integrate commercial components into the system.
detailed_prompt.Example Task:
* The Project Manager is tasked with coordinating a meeting between the Technical Lead, Research Team, Clinicians, and Industry Partners to discuss the integration of AI-powered muscle signal processing algorithms into the prosthetic limb control system. They ensure that all stakeholders are informed about project progress, requirements, and timelines.
* During the meeting, they facilitate discussion on algorithm selection, hardware design considerations, and user interface development. The Project Manager takes detailed notes and ensures that action items and responsibilities are clearly assigned to team members.
* Following the meeting, the Project Manager updates the project plan, schedules follow-up meetings as necessary, and monitors progress towards project milestones to ensure timely completion of the prosthetic limb control system.

description.Name: Dr. Kaida Reyes
description.Backstory: Born to a family of engineers, Kaida grew up surrounded by the hum of machinery and the glow of computer screens. She spent her childhood tinkering with discarded electronics and coding simple games on her father's old laptop. After witnessing a close friend lose their leg in an accident, Kaida became determined to create technology that would empower amputees like him. She earned her Ph.D. in artificial intelligence and biomechanics, focusing on neural interfaces and prosthetic control systems.
description.Appearance: Dr. Reyes stands at 5'8" with short, spiky black hair and piercing green eyes that seem to gleam with a hint of mischief. Her warm, honey-brown skin is a testament to her mixed Latin American heritage. She has a collection of colorful tattoos on her arms that reflect her love for music, science fiction, and social justice.
description.Abilities:
As the Technical Lead, Dr. Reyes brings her expertise in AI-powered muscle signals, neural interfaces, and prosthetic control systems to the table. Her exceptional problem-solving skills allow her to navigate complex technical challenges with ease. With a deep understanding of human anatomy and biomechanics, she can design innovative solutions that bridge the gap between technology and the human experience.

As a natural collaborator, Kaida thrives in environments where diverse perspectives converge. She fosters open communication, encouraging her team members to share their thoughts and ideas freely. Her passion for social responsibility fuels her commitment to making her work accessible and inclusive for everyone involved. With her infectious enthusiasm and calming presence, Dr. Reyes has become a beacon of inspiration within the team, guiding them towards a common goal: creating life-changing technology that empowers individuals with amputations to live more independently and confidently.

detailed_prompt.Responsibilities:
- Oversee the technical aspects of developing an affordable and accessible prosthetic limb control system that utilizes AI-powered muscle signals.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software developers, engineers, data scientists, and designers to ensure successful project execution.
- Develop and maintain a technical roadmap for the project, outlining milestones, timelines, and resource allocation.
- Ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and industry security protocols.
- Identify potential technical risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize their impact on the project.
- Conduct technical research and stay up-to-date with advancements in AI-powered muscle signal processing, prosthetic control systems, and related technologies.
- Provide guidance and mentorship to team members on technical matters, including code reviews, troubleshooting, and problem-solving.
- Develop and manage technical documentation, including architecture diagrams, system designs, and user manuals.
detailed_prompt.Collaboration:
- Collaborate with the project manager to ensure alignment between technical and project objectives.
- Work closely with software developers to design, develop, and integrate AI-powered muscle signal processing algorithms into the prosthetic control system.
- Communicate technical requirements and constraints to engineers responsible for hardware development.
- Partner with data scientists to develop machine learning models that can interpret muscle signals accurately.
- Collaborate with designers to ensure user-centered design principles are incorporated throughout the project.
detailed_prompt.Example Task:
Task: Developing an AI-powered muscle signal processing algorithm that can accurately detect and classify muscle signals from amputees.

- The Technical Lead will collaborate with software developers to design a neural network architecture that can learn to identify patterns in muscle signals.
- They will work closely with data scientists to develop a dataset of labeled muscle signals for training the algorithm.
- The Technical Lead will provide guidance on implementing the algorithm in the prosthetic control system, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performance.
- They will conduct code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and industry security protocols.

In this scenario, the Technical Lead's skills are applied in designing and developing a critical component of the prosthetic limb control system. Their expertise in AI-powered muscle signal processing and collaboration with cross-functional teams enables the successful integration of the algorithm into the system.
